t:intro.p: The NaiveBayesTextClassifierTrainer function takes training data as input and outputs a model table.

pre.tt: SELECT * FROM NaiveBayesTextClassifierTrainer ( ON NaiveBayesTextClassifierInternal ( ON input_table AS InputTable PARTITION BY doc_category_column [ ON categories_table AS CategoriesTable DIMENSION ] [ ON stop_words_table AS StopWords DIMENSION ] USING TokenColumn ('token_column') [ ModelType ({ 'Multinomial' | 'Bernoulli' }) ] [ DocIDColumns ({ 'doc_id_column' | doc_id_column_range }[,...])] DocCategoryColumn ('doc_category_column') [ CategoryColumn ('category_column') | Categories ('category' [,...]) ] [ StopWordsColumn ('stop_words_column') | StopWordsList ('word' [,...]) ] ) AS alias_1 PARTITION BY 1 ) AS alias_2;

div.dd: Specify the name of the InputTable column that contains the tokens to classify.
[Optional] Specify the model type of the text classifier.
Default: 'Multinomial'. See the sections that follow this table.
[Required if ModelType is 'Bernoulli', unnecessary otherwise.] Specify the names of the token table columns that contain the document identifier.
Specify the name of the InputTable column that contains the document category.
[Optional] Use only if you specify CategoriesTable. Specify the name of the CategoriesTable column that contains the prediction categories to use in the model.
If you omit both CategoriesTable and CategoryColumn, the function uses all categories specified by DocCategoryColumn.
[Optional] Specify the prediction categories to use in the model.
Default: All categories specified by DocCategoryColumn.
[Optional] Specify the name of the StopWords table column that contains the stop words.
Default: First column of StopWords table

[Optional] Specify either this syntax element or the StopWords table, but not both.
Specify words to ignore (such as a, an, and the).

td.div: Probability that new document D is classified to category i
Count of token j in category i (including duplicate tokens)
Token count in category i (including duplicate tokens)
Count of token j in category i (including duplicate tokens)
Number of unique tokens in training set V
Probability that new document D is classified to category i
Number of unique tokens in training set V
Token in V that is not in document D
Document count in category i that contains token j
Document count in category i that contains token k
Number of unique categories in category set C
Contains classified training tokens. Usually output by a tokenizing function, such as TextTokenizer or TextParser.

[Optional] Contains prediction categories to use in model, which you can also specify with Categories syntax element. If you omit both this table and Categories syntax element, function uses all categories specified by DocCategoryColumn syntax element.
[Optional] Contains stop words (a, an, the, and so on). You can specify stop words with either this table or StopWordsList syntax element.
[Column appears once for each specified doc_id_column.] Identifier of document that contains classified training tokens.

Category of document.
Note: Partition table by this column.
Probability that token is in category.

ul.li:
input: Created by applying the TextTokenizer function to the training table complaints, a log of vehicle complaints
In complaints, the category column indicates whether the car has been in a crash.

td.div: consumer was driving approximately 45 mph hit a deer with the front bumper and then ran into an embankment head-on passenger's side air bag did deploy hit windshield and deployed outward. driver's side airbag cover opened but did not inflate it was still folded causing injuries.

when vehicle was involved in a crash totalling vehicle driver's side/ passenger's side air bags did not deploy. vehicle was making a left turn and was hit by a ford f350 traveling about 35 mph on the front passenger's side. driver hit his head-on the steering wheel. hurt his knee and received neck and back injuries.

consumer has experienced following problems; 1.) both lower ball joints wear out excessively; 2.) head gasket leaks; and 3.) cruise control would shut itself off while driving without foot pressing on brake pedal.

t:intro.p: This call creates the model table, complaints_tokens_model, by calling NaiveBayesTextClassifierTrainer. It creates the NaiveBayesTextClassifierTrainer input table, token, by applying TextTokenizer to the table complaints.
This query returns the following table:

pre.tt: SELECT * FROM complaints_tokens_model ORDER BY prob desc;

t:intro.p: Download a zip file of all examples and a SQL script file that creates their input tables from the download tab in the left pane.
